docs.title: DDI Dataset Documentation
docs.text:
This site documents the datasets and variables available in the Dementia Disease Initiative (DDI) project. The documentation is generated from the base schemas and associated metadata from the XNAT data model, combined with hand-authored content for enriched descriptions and context.

Use the navigation to explore project, experiment-level scopes, and the flat dataset variable catalogue.

docs.title: Experiments Index
docs.text: Experiment Description Page mh_MedHistData CRF Part I: Includes Social information, Family history, Current medical history (participant and informant), Current medication, Stimulants, Other bodily func... mh_MedHistData diag_DiagnosisData CRF Part IV: Includes Diagnosis staging and etiology diag_DiagnosisData dem_ddiDemographicData DDI base demographic data dem_ddiDemographicData

docs.title: Dataset Variables
docs.text: The flat dataset catalogue merges exportable variables across experiments along with computed variables defined in config/computed.yaml.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
CRF Part I: Includes Social information, Family history, Current medical history (participant and informant), Current medication, Stimulants, Other bodily functions, Previous medical history and Geriatric depression scale

The Medical History experiment collects comprehensive health and lifestyle information from participants through multiple sections.

docs.title: Administration
docs.text: Includes fields for test leader, test location, and CRF version tracking.

docs.title: Sections
docs.text:
• Social Information: Demographic and social background details
  • Family History: Hereditary health conditions and family medical background
  • Current Medical History-Participant: Active health conditions reported by the participant
  • Current Medication: Medications currently being taken
  • Stimulants: Use of stimulant substances
  • Other Bodily Functions: Additional physiological or functional information
  • Previous Medical History: Past medical conditions and treatments
  • Geriatric Depression Scale: Standardized depression screening assessment
  • Current Medical History-Informant: Health conditions reported by an informant (when available)
  • Relatives' Stress Scale (RSS): Standardized stress measurement for relatives

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Medical History experiment collects comprehensive health and lifestyle information from participants through multiple sections.

docs.title: Administration
docs.text: Includes fields for test leader, test location, and CRF version tracking.

docs.title: Sections
docs.text:
• Social Information: Demographic and social background details
  • Family History: Hereditary health conditions and family medical background
  • Current Medical History-Participant: Active health conditions reported by the participant
  • Current Medication: Medications currently being taken
  • Stimulants: Use of stimulant substances
  • Other Bodily Functions: Additional physiological or functional information
  • Previous Medical History: Past medical conditions and treatments
  • Geriatric Depression Scale: Standardized depression screening assessment
  • Current Medical History-Informant: Health conditions reported by an informant (when available)
  • Relatives' Stress Scale (RSS): Standardized stress measurement for relatives

docs.title: Conventions
docs.text:
• Variable definitions come from display-field sidecar metadata files.
  • Only variables included in the dump display version are treated as export fields.
  • Generated pages use a stable marker (<!-- AUTO:VARIABLES -->) for variable sections.
